title: Python Programming
content: Python is a high-level programming language. It was developed by Guido van Rossum and is known for its simple syntax.
author: Guido van Rossum

title: What is Data Science
content: Data science is the art of extracting meaningful insights from data. It uses machine learning and statistical methods.
author: Anonymous

title: Machine Learning
content: Machine learning is a branch of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn from experience. There are two main types: supervised and unsupervised learning.
author: Tom Mitchell

title: Deep Learning
content: Deep learning is a machine learning technique that uses multi-layered artificial neural networks. It is successful in image recognition and natural language processing.
author: Geoffrey Hinton

title: Natural Language Processing
content: NLP is technology that enables computers to understand human language. It includes applications such as text analysis, sentiment analysis, and chatbot development.
author: Christopher Manning

title: FAISS Library
content: FAISS is a high-performance similarity search library developed by Facebook AI Research. It can perform fast searches among billions of vectors.
author: Facebook AI

title: LangChain Framework
content: LangChain is a Python framework used for developing LLM applications. It offers features for prompt management, chain creation, and agent development.
author: Harrison Chase

title: Transformers Architecture
content: Transformers is a neural network architecture proposed by Google in 2017 using the attention mechanism. It forms the foundation of models like BERT and GPT.
author: Google Research

title: RAG System
content: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems retrieve relevant documents from a knowledge base and feed them to the LLM to generate more accurate answers. It reduces hallucination.
author: Facebook AI

title: Vector Database
content: Vector databases are databases optimized for storing embedding vectors and performing similarity searches. Examples include Pinecone, Weaviate, and Chroma.
author: Anonymous
